clinical_study.brief_title: BDx 7 Day ECG Patch: Electrode Adhesion Clinical Study
clinical_study.official_title: BDx 7 Day ECG Patch: Electrode Adhesion Clinical Study

oversight_info.authority: United States: Food and Drug Administration

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this research study is to learn if a new 7 day patch ECG recording monitor can serve the same purpose as standard monitoring systems. The new 7day patch is significantly smaller and lighter than previous ECG recorders.

detailed_description.textblock: The primary purpose of this research is to evaluate ECG signal quality of the BDx 7 day ECG Patch heart monitor after 7 full days of wear, establishing that the device is safe and effective to wear for up to 7 days.

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Cohort, Time Perspective: Prospective

primary_outcome.description: The study will evaluate adhesive performance/durability by evaluating the Signal Quality of ECG data on the subjects (5 men and 5 women) in accordance with the requirements of FDA's ECG Electrode Guidance (section 5.A.3)1 and the ANSI/AAMI EC-12 Disposable ECG electrode technical standard (sections 4.4 and 5.4)2.

secondary_outcome.description: Skin comfort or discomfort Device comfort Device stability and contact

study_pop.textblock: cardiac patients followed at the study site's location

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- cardiac patient volunteers (5 male and 5 female)
Exclusion Criteria:
- skin rash or infection over the sternum
- Sternal incision within 3 months from the date of enrollment
